verses.text: Finally, my brethren, rejoice in the Lord. To write the same \add things\add* to you, to me indeed \add is\add* not grievous, but for you \add it is\add* safe.
Beware of dogs, beware of evil workers, beware of the concision.
For we are the circumcision, which worship God in the spirit, and rejoice in Christ Jesus, and have no confidence in the flesh.
Though I \add might\add* also have confidence in the flesh. If any other \add man\add* thinketh that \add he hath whereof he\add* might trust in the flesh, I more:
circumcised the eighth day, of the stock of Israel, of the tribe of Benjamin, a Hebrew of the Hebrews; as touching the law, a Pharisee;
concerning zeal, persecuting the church; touching the righteousness which is in the law, blameless.
But what \add things\add* were gain to me, those I counted loss for Christ.

Yea doubtless, and I count all \add things but\add* loss for the excellency of the knowledge of Christ Jesus my Lord: for whom I have suffered the loss of all \add things\add*, and do count \add them but\add* dung, that I may win Christ,
and be found in him, not having mine own righteousness, which is of the law, but that which is through the faith of Christ, the righteousness which is of God by faith:
that \add I\add* may know him, and the power of his resurrection, and the fellowship of his sufferings, being made conformable unto his death;
if by any means I might attain unto the resurrection of the dead.
Not as though I had already attained, either were already perfect: but I follow \add after\add*, if that I may apprehend \add that\add* for which also I am apprehended of Christ Jesus.

Brethren, I count not myself to have apprehended: but \add this\add* one \add thing I do\add*, forgetting those \add things which are\add* behind, and reaching forth unto those \add things which are\add* before,
I press toward the mark for the prize of the high calling of God in Christ Jesus.
Let us therefore, as many as \add be\add* perfect, be thus minded: and if in any \add thing\add* ye be otherwise minded, God shall reveal even this unto you.
Nevertheless, whereto we have \add already\add* attained, \add let us\add* walk by the same rule, \add let us\add* mind the same \add thing\add*.
Brethren, be followers together of me, and mark them which walk so as ye have us for an ensample.
(For many walk, of whom I have told you often, and now tell \add you\add* even weeping, \add that they are\add* the enemies of the cross of Christ:
whose end \add is\add* destruction, whose God \add is their\add* belly, and \add whose\add* glory \add is\add* in their shame, who mind earthly \add things\add*.)
For our conversation is in heaven; from whence also we look for the Saviour, the Lord Jesus Christ:
who shall change our vile body, that it may be fashioned like unto his glorious body, according to the working whereby he is able even to subdue all \add things\add* unto himself.
